Uses of Class
org.ow2.bonita.facade.exception.RuleNotFoundException

Packages that use RuleNotFoundException
org.ow2.bonita.facade Contains interfaces for accessing Bonita APIs. 
org.ow2.bonita.facade.exception Contains exception classes thrown by Bonita APIs. 
org.ow2.bonita.facade.internal All interfaces in this package are for internal use only. 
 

Uses of RuleNotFoundException in org.ow2.bonita.facade
 

Methods in org.ow2.bonita.facade that throw RuleNotFoundException
<E extends AbstractUUID>
void
ManagementAPI.addExceptionsToRuleByUUID(java.lang.String ruleUUID, java.util.Set<E> exceptions)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method add exceptions to a rule identified by its name and so increase the scope of the rule.
 void ManagementAPI.applyRuleToEntities(java.lang.String ruleUUID, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> userUUIDs, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> roleUUIDs, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> groupUUIDs, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> membershipUUIDs, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> entityIDs)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method is the way to impose conditions to the general policy for the given entity.
For instance applying rules to a collection of user defines what access the users have or do not have.
 void ManagementAPI.deleteRuleByUUID(java.lang.String ruleUUID)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method deletes a rule identified by its name.
It means that the entities bound to this rule will then follow the global policy (unless they are bound to another rule).
 Rule ManagementAPI.getRuleByUUID(java.lang.String ruleUUID)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
Get a rule identified by its name.
 java.util.List<Rule> ManagementAPI.getRulesByUUIDs(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> ruleUUIDs)
          Gets rules from their names.
<E extends AbstractUUID>
void
ManagementAPI.removeExceptionsFromRuleByUUID(java.lang.String ruleUUID, java.util.Set<E> exceptions)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method removes exceptions from rule and so reduces the scope of the rule.
 void ManagementAPI.removeRuleFromEntities(java.lang.String ruleUUID, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> userUUIDs, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> roleUUIDs, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> groupUUIDs, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> membershipUUIDs, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> entityIDs)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method is the way to remove conditions to the general policy for the given entity.
For instance removing rules previously applied to a user (entity) defines what access the user has or does not have.
 Rule ManagementAPI.updateRuleByUUID(java.lang.String ruleUUID, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String label, java.lang.String description)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
Update a rule identified by its name with the values stored in the rule object.
